text: Christopher Stuckmann (born April 15, 1991) is an American movie critic, movie director, producer, author, and YouTube star. As of September 2018, he has more than 1.3 million subscribers, and over 360 million total video views. In 2017, he directed, produced, edited, and wrote the short comedic horror movie Auditorium 6 which earned him multiple awards. == Filmography == Year Title Role Notes 2007 Indiana Jones and the Jewel of the Forest Indiana Jones Also director, writer, editor; short fan film 2013 Julia The Man Also director, writer, producer, editor; short film 2015 Drinking Game Director, writer, producer, editor, cinematographer Short film 2016 The Stuckmann Identity Jason Bourne Also director 2017 Auditorium 6 Director, writer, producer, editor Short film TBA Notes from Melanie Penance == Bibliography == * The Film Buff's Bucket List: The 50 Movies of the 2000s to See Before You Die (2016) * Anime Impact: The Movies and Shows that Changed the World of Japanese Animation (2018) == Accolades == Year Award Category Result Ref. 2017 Best Shorts Competition Award of Excellence Special Mention: Film Short 2018 The Indie Horror Film Festival Best Short The International Horror Hotel Best Director of an Ohio Film Best Horror/Comedy == References == == Other websites == * Chris Stuckmann at IMDb * Chris Stuckmann at Rotten Tomatoes Category:1991 births Category:Living people Category:Movie directors from Ohio Category:American movie critics Category:American YouTubers
title: Chris Stuckmann
